title: Business Inventory Approvals Checklist
metaTitle: Business Inventory Sale Approvals Checklist | Proof Cellars
metaDescription: Selling business assets (liquor inventory) requires proper authorization. Use this checklist to ensure your sale is compliant and approved.
summary: Who should approve a sale and what documentation to keep for internal controls and clean records.

sections.heading: Quick Answer
content: Selling company assets without a paper trail is a recipe for an audit disaster (or theft accusation).
list: Get written authorization from an Officer of the company.
Ensure the Bill of Sale lists the Company as the seller.
Direct the payment to the Company bank account.
Keep the Purchase Order for tax filing.

sections.heading: Who Must Sign Off
list: The Operational Lead (e.g., F&B Director or Office Manager) initiates the sale.
The Financial Lead (e.g., CFO or Controller) approves the asset disposal.
If you are the owner, simply sign as 'Owner' or 'President'.

sections.heading: Required Documentation
list: Inventory List (Asset Schedule).
Purchase Agreement (Contract).
Bill of Sale (Transfer of Title).
Final Invoice (Proof of Payment).

sections.heading: Proceeds and Payments
list: We strongly prefer paying via Wire or Check to the entity name.
Sending cash/personal checks to an employee for company assets is a huge red flag.
We can reference a PO number on the payment for your accounting software.

sections.heading: Common Mistakes
list: Selling assets for cash 'under the table' (tax fraud).
Not removing asset tags or inventory stickers.
Failing to update the balance sheet (assets should be written down).

sections.heading: What to Do Next
list: Draft an internal email: 'Request to liquidate obsolete inventory valued at approx $X'.
Get a 'Yes' reply.
Submit the list to us.
We handle the external paperwork.

faqs.question: Do I need a lawyer?
faqs.answer: Usually no, unless the company is in bankruptcy or complex litigation.

faqs.question: Can you pay a third party?
faqs.answer: Only with a written Direction of Payment signed by the company officer.

faqs.question: Is sales tax involved?
faqs.answer: As a licensed wholesaler/retailer, our purchase is usually for 'Resale', so sales tax is often not applicable (we provide a Resale Certificate).

faqs.question: What if the business is closed?
faqs.answer: We can buy from the winding-up entity or the owner personally if assets were distributed.
